title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8188-3.3 - Review of application
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8188-3.3 - Review of application

State Regulations
(a) If
the applicant satisfies the minimum qualification standards, ORPTS shall notify
the applicant accordingly and advise the applicant of the schedule for the
basic course of training. If the applicant requests the comprehensive
examination, ORPTS shall advise the applicant whether he or she qualifies for
the comprehensive examination, and, if so, provide the applicant with the
schedule for such examination. (b) If the applicant does not satisfy the standards, ORPTS shall notify the
applicant accordingly. Such notice shall set forth the reasons for the
determination and state that the applicant may request a review of such
determination. (c) An individual
adversely affected by a determination may request a review within 15 days of
such determination. Such request must be made in writing and be addressed to
the New York State Department of Taxation and Finance, Office of Real Property

Tax Services. (d) ORPTS shall
provide the applicant with written notification of his or her affirmation or
reversal of the initial determination, including the reasons for such
decision. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
§§
8188-3.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
